item.description:
The Global Ideas Festival is an annual event at the highly acclaimed Metropolitan Learning Center (a magnet school, grades 6-12 http://www.crec.org/m.... This year's festival is entitled: Haiti: Expression Memories Rebirth, and the goal is to raise awareness and funds to help rebuild a school in Haiti that was destroyed in earthquake. This school, which is called L'Ecole le Bon Samaritan (Good Samaritan School), has had a five year long relationship with the Metropolitan Learning Center. L'Ecole le Bon Samaritan was founded by Jean-Elie Millien, formerly an Episcopal rector in Stamford, CT, and his wife. The couple returned to their native Haiti for retirement and converted their Carrefour home into a school. At the time of the quake, the school was serving 180 students. In the aftermath, their close friends and colleagues Puck Purnell, an episcopal rector in Bloomfield http://www.oldstandre..., and his wife Joann Kimball, founded the Good Samaritan Rebuilding Fund http://osa-haiti.blog....

The poetry reading/art auction is just one of a week long series of events. The art to be auctioned is the work of Metropolitan Learning Center Students.

Other events include a choir performance Thursday at 4:15 and several documentary films being shown from 12:45 - 3:00 on Friday.
